intro: Gomphostemma dolichobotrys, commonly known as the long-stemmed gomphostemma, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various ailments.
